before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"6inf6","text":"- Wear attire appropriate for constant re-entry into the water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"26vov","text":"- Check that a working seconds stopwatch is present..","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"dqnun","text":"This procedure is used for costal monitoring and has been tested along the majority of the coast of Mo'orea, French Polynesia; completed by UC Berkeley's Island Sustainability classes. This protocol includes steps to collect observation data regarding birds, costal armoring, and boats, along shoreline transects. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"6cu8q","text":"- Do not trample coral.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7amfj","text":"- Do not walk through private property, unless you have explicit authorization.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"884gu","text":"- Write observations in a field notebook.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"be1b9","text":"- Take pictures to document your transect.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1kcmc","text":"- Try interacting with people as soon as possible and explaining what you are doing/getting feedback.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"1bevn","text":"- Gaia GPS mobile app","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"991dj","text":"- Field notebooks","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9kgb3","text":"- Stopwatch (with seconds)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dqogb","text":"- Water-appropriate shoes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c8a34","text":"- Tape-measurer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"94s8s","text":"- Pencil","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"74r90","text":"When done tracking, don’t forget to save and export track as .gpx file. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"28gv1","text":"Start time-stamp as soon as coastal profile changes or as soon as you are no longer able to monitor.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3a47p","text":"Walking along the shore, take a time stamp of any boats, canoes, jetskis, or other vessels on the water that are visible to you. Record under Time-Stamp using military time up to the millisecond. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"48huv","text":"Start a time-stamp if backtracking or if you left the coast and make note.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"86aun","text":"Estimate the distance in meters from the coastal armoring to the shoreline and record on data sheet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6nqn5","text":"If a fishing vessel, ID each vessel as one of the following under fisherBoat: outrigger, motorboat, swimon-foot. Leave this section blank if not a fishing vessel.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"5o6bh","text":"Have two team-members start a track (full battery).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fl6nq","text":"After starting track recording, with the GAIA-App take a picture of the group’s hand-watch with seconds showing on the hand-watch (will help making sure time on watch and GPS time are synced).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2nll7","text":"If applicable, note the type of fishing gear under fisherGear: spear, line, or net.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8060o","text":"Under fisherN, record the number of fishermen in the crew if applicable. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e653m","text":"Under vesselType, regardless of if the vessel is for fishing, ID the vessel from the following categories: closed-cabin motorboat, opened-cabin motorboat, tourist-operator motorboat,","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2eqd","text":"sailboat, jet-ski [indicate number of jetskis in ()].","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"brn8m","text":"Under anch-navigating, indicate whether the vessel (regardless of if it is fishing), is anchoring or navigating. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bc5kd","text":"Repeat for each new vessel spotted. Use a single entry for each vessel unless it is a group of jetskis which pass at the same timestamp. Indicate if you cannot see the gear in the fishing boat. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5va7u","text":"Record-stamp on data sheet and tecord the coast types on the data sheet using the following categories: unArmored (no apparent human-made alteration), armRocks (armored coast w/ piles of rocks/stones), armSeaWall (armored coast cement/concrete wall), and armOther (other category of armored coast). When you encounter a perpendicular structure (dock/over-water bungalow/stone alignment), record a time-stamp and the type of perpendicular structure on the data sheet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1kjef","text":"At the end of the day, take a picture of your notebooks before data entry.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c6c1","text":"Walking along the shore or as close to the shore as possible, write down the time stamp of every water outlet walked by.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fk5eo","text":"Try estimating width of outlet (in feet or meters. Write down the estimate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8nqm","text":"Bird Observations","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4gg6a","text":"When you see a bird, record the number and identify whether the birds(s) is an egret or heron. Refer to the bird ID sheet, linked here. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":130,"length":4}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"C23CBA9AC50A11EDADD90A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://docs.google.com/document/d/1g797VgQbXlEd6cmfwh1OZ378Q9xsHoN34ShO3ft_cis/edit?usp=sharing"}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"b8q8v","text":"Record the timestamp at the time you spotted the bird. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"mq4g","text":"Mark if the water outlet is flowing and any other relevant observations about it. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Moorea Transect Protocol
warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"89rjo","text":"- Eels and stone fish may be present","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"92kk9","text":"- Remain wary of stray dogs (staying grouped and pretending to pick up a stone or stick to throw at them is a sufficient deterrent)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3b4cu","text":"- Entering private property often happens by accident, be prepared with phrases in the local language to explain who you are","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
